author: MySonderStory
body:
S3 Partners' director tweeted an update, GME is still **113.31%** shorted as of Jan 29 (today)!

[GME short interest is $11.20B; 57.83M shares shorted; 113.31% of Float; 53.12% S3 SI% Flt; 29% fee & easing. Shares shorted down -5.08M shares, worth $983 million, -8.07%, last week. Shorts down -$19.75B in 2021 mark-to-market losses; down -$7.83B on today's +70% move.](https://twitter.com/ihors3/status/1355194252674953219)

He also called out CNBC for reporting wrong S3 short % in [this tweet with his chart](https://twitter.com/ihors3/status/1355226736733073416?s=20).

author: Friendly_Crab

author: sugarcoated__
body:
Alright my lovelies, time to strap in.

* It is likely we will face a dip EOD. They want us to panic sell, and I can understand if you want to because most of us would've liked this to have rocketed by now. But we must hold! Why?
*  [$GME](https://twitter.com/search?q=%24GME&src=cashtag_click) short interest is $11.20B; 57.83M shares shorted; 113.31% of Float; 53.12% S3 SI% Flt; 29% fee & easing. Shares shorted down -5.08M shares, worth $983 million, -8.07%, last week. Shorts down -$19.75B in 2021 mark-to-market losses; down -$7.83B on today's +70% move.  This means that 113% of the float is still shorted, which is could for us. Some shorts have covered but others have taken their place, hoping that we will give up.
* Don't worry because of the low volume. I have been all in already for 2 days and a lot of people already are. So with high prices, there are low sales. You must hold.

&#x200B;

Source for the float: [https://twitter.com/ihors3/status/1355194252674953219](https://twitter.com/ihors3/status/1355194252674953219)

If you want to know what the fuck is going on: [https://isthesqueezesquoze.com/](https://isthesqueezesquoze.com/)

Level 2 data stream: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7ql\_DMRopo&feature=youtu.be&ab\_channel=StocksBigPlays](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7ql_DMRopo&feature=youtu.be&ab_channel=StocksBigPlays)

Put on your helmet, fasten your chin straps and HOLD. THE. FUCKING. LINE.

&#x200B;

This is not financial advice. I like this stock because I played Zelda in the 90s.

author: Investorsparadise
body:
This is from S3 partners_ $GME short interest is $11.20B; 57.83M shares shorted; 113.31% of Float; 53.12% S3 SI% Flt; 29% fee & easing. Shares shorted down -5.08M shares, worth $983 million, -8.07%, last week. 

Shorts down -$19.75B in 2021 mark-to-market losses; down -$7.83B on today's +70% move.

The drop in shorts took place on Thursday when they limited buying and drove the price down.However is seem NEW shorts have taken up a new position, from what I’ve read the “new” shorts come with a higher interest rate of above 80% (don’t know if anyone can confirm) Since the price bounced back I imagine that had to fucking hurt! If the pressure remains they will be severely bleeding out. 
To the mooooon!! 🚀 

This is not financial advise, but I like the stock.

body:
Jumped into BUS today during the dip, should have waited until the 2.99, jumped in at 3.25 instead all good. 

SCR has been so hyped that people eho didn't buy into it by now must mot really care for it.

I'm still confused on why FLT is moving, can't think of anything other than the possibility it will be in the space ARK, maybe that's what people are speculating.

Jumped into BITF after way too long of waiting, can only assume it will drop off the face of the earth now.

author: YesXplain
body:
Good luck. Im heavily against FLT because of the many challenges of drone delivery. Highly regulated flight paths, weather obstacles, equipment damages/theft and most importantly privacy concerns. 

Have u seen that hitch hiking robot news way back? He was murdered and robbed travelling in america lmao

author: flyingfunk
body: If you actually look into these companies FLT is way way ahead of Amazon. Amazon recently shut down their in house drone development years after saying they were a "few years away from home delivery" Yeah right. FLT is all about the software system called FLYTE. This system allows ANY drone to be hooked up to it. Think small drones all the way up to a Boeing 767 (CEO said this could be done today is regulations allowed it).   Software as a Service or SAAS is the way to make big money, not the drones themselves. Drone Delivery Canada does both.

Parlayed my winnings into crypto related stocks in late Dec and last week. They have been on a tear.

My only loser is ABXX.

I've been very lucky but I'll take it.

author: pokershark12
body:
January 13, 2021
January 13: Air Canada Cargo Helps Canadians in the Fight Against Covid-19
A Valued Partner in Vaccine Distribution

COVID-19 vaccines are being transported around the world and Air Canada Cargo, a trusted supply chain partner, is proud to be involved in bringing the vaccines to Canadians. 

“We are seeing shipments of vaccines and vaccine consumables being transported by Air Canada Cargo for distribution in Canada since December. These shipments are a result of close collaboration with our supply chain partners, and our operational readiness to expertly handle them” said Vito Cerone, Vice-President, Cargo Sales and Commercial Strategy.

Air Canada Cargo underwent an extensive preparedness exercise in 2020 to ensure all aspects of its operations were up-to-date and reflective of current requirements and standards for transporting vaccines.

In July, Air Canada became the first airline in Canada to achieve IATA’s CEIV Pharma certification. CEIV Pharma certification ensures international and national compliance to safeguard product integrity, while addressing specific air cargo needs. Certification requires that facilities, equipment, operations and staff comply with all applicable standards, regulations and guidelines expected from pharmaceutical manufacturers. 

As part of its preparation, Air Canada Cargo also finalized agreements with additional suppliers of active, passive and hybrid packages, and increased capabilities for pharma handling by undergoing a thorough review of all stations in its network, including those managed by third parties.

See more on air Canada’s website news page. Maybe Flt will be involved

author: zarhockk
body: What's the difference between 113.31% of Float are short & 53.12% S3 SI% Flt ?

author: inconspicuousITguy
body:
https://twitter.com/ihors3/status/1355197063504547841?s=20

It appears our numbers are close, it's claimed to be a real SI of 53% 


Ripped directly from tweet:

Question: Why is S3's 53.12% SI % Flt different than 113.31%? is this taking into account the actual amount that is float that is owned by WSB that will continue to hold?



Answer: Our float number includes the "synthetic longs" that are created from short selling. This is an accurate calculation of the actual tradable liquidity in the market.  shares shorted / (float + shares shorted)
